sentences.en: And who in China would have the temerity to arrange such an encounter?
sentences.cn: 中国又有谁能够如此胆大妄为地安排这种会见 呢 ?

sentences.en: Conducting the premiere of a symphony without a rehearsal requires temerity.
sentences.cn: 不排练而直接指挥一部交响乐的首次公演是鲁莽的.

sentences.en: He actually had the temerity to tell her to lose weight.
sentences.cn: 他竟然放肆地叫她减肥。

sentences.en: He had the temerity to ask for higher wages after only a day's work.
sentences.cn: 只工作了一天,他就蛮不讲理地要求增加工资.

sentences.en: He has even had the temerity to invoke the names of Martin Luther King Jr and Malcolm X in defence of his actions.
sentences.cn: 他竟然敢搬出马丁·路德·金和马尔科姆·艾克斯的名字来为自己的行为辩解。

sentences.en: If it is so temerity to crises , Dan Lu non - scene I could not.
sentences.cn: 如果就这样冒失地闯过去,丹露非恨死我不可.

sentences.en: It was amazing that she should exhibIt'such temerity, but he would teach her!
sentences.cn: 她竟然表现得如此放肆,真是惊人, 但他要教训她!
她们对他的轻率鲁莽感到惊异.

sentences.en: Tins took some temerity, but it was fruitless.
sentences.cn: 这件事做得有点莽撞, 但结果还是无用.

words.tran_cn: 鲁莽的；不顾一切的；极大胆的

trans.tran_en: when someone says or does something in a way that shows a lack of respect for other people and is likely to offend them
